channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Freinage régénératif et autonomie débordante : on a testé le Vefaa Bonjour Techno, un vélo électrique qui marque des points
item.description: Essai transformé pour le tout premier vélo électrique de la startup rhodanienne Vefaa, car le Vefaa Bonjour Techno réunit la connectivité, la simplicité de conduite, du confort et un bel équipement. Nous l'avons testé, voici notre verdict.

item.title: Chamelo Music Shield Review: These Sporty Speaker Glasses Have One Thing Meta Needs
item.description: Chamelo's audio glasses have an expensive magic trick, and I wish more smart glasses would follow suit.

item.title: Lenovo Legion Go Gen 2 Review: A High-End Gaming Handheld
item.description: This premium gaming handheld loads up with features, but Windows still holds it back from being the easy option.

item.title: How to watch Bournemouth vs Chelsea: Premier League 2025/26 live streams, TV channels, kick-off time
item.description: We'll show you all the ways you can watch Bournemouth vs Chelseas in the 2025/26 Premier League as the Blues look to revive their title challenge.

item.title: Engadget review recap: Dell 16 Premium, Nikon ZR, Ooni Volt 2 and more
item.description:
We’ve slept off our collective turkey coma and returned to the review lab here at Engadget. Our team may also be in full CES prep mode, but we’ve got a few more devices to get off or our desks before 2025 is over. Catch up on all of the reviews you might have missed over the last few weeks — a perfect activity for a lazy December weekend. Dell 16 Premium
There’s no denying the design of the Dell 16 Premium makes the laptop live up to its name. Unfortunately, all of that polish leads to some issues: a high price and hampered usability. “The more I looked at the Dell 16 Premium's beautiful fac...

item.title: Polymarket User Accused of $1 Million Insider Trade on Google Search Markets
item.description: Prediction market observers have long warned that the business is ripe for insider trading.

item.title: Un TV TCL 4K Mini LED 144 Hz de 65″ à -60 %, le Nothing Phone(3a) Pro en pack à -30 % et -300 € sur une barre de son Harman Kardon premium — les deals de la semaine
item.description: Si vous n’avez pas pu consulter les bons plans de cette semaine, voici ce que vous avez raté : un TV TCL 4K Mini LED 144 Hz de 65″ avec plus de 50 % de remise, le Nothing Phone (3a) Pro en pack à -30 % et la nouvelle barre de son immersive de Harman Kardon coûte déjà 300 euros de moins.

item.title: We’ll Be Dumping a Garbage Truck of Plastic Every Second by 2040, Report Warns
item.description: The outlook is grim, but a new report lays out a path to nearly eradicate plastic packaging pollution within the next 15 years.

item.title: Why Tehran Is Running Out of Water
item.description: Because of shifting storms and sweltering summers, Iran’s capital faces a future “Day Zero” when the taps run dry.

item.title: Bose Smart Soundbar vs Sony Bravia Theater Bar 6: which Dolby Atmos soundbar is right for you?
item.description: The Sony Bravia Theater Bar 6 and the Bose Smart Soundbar are great Dolby Atmos soundbars, but for very different reasons.

item.title: T-Mobile's end-of-year deals include four free iPhone 17, Galaxy S25, and more – but you'll have to be quick
item.description: T-Mobile's huge end-of-year seasonal phone deals are still live, but they're likely expiring soon, so don't hesitate if you're looking to upgrade.

item.title: A Marvel beat-'em-up, long-awaited survival horror and other new indie games worth checking out
item.description: Welcome to our latest roundup of what's going on in the indie game space. A bunch of titles that are arriving very late to make it into game of the year conversations debuted this week, and we learned some new details about upcoming projects, such as a release date for a rad-looking arena shooter called Don't Stop, Girlypop.Marvel Cosmic Invasion is one of the higher-profile indies to hit consoles and PC this week. It's from Tribute Games and publisher Dotemu, the same pair that brought us Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder's Revenge. Cosmic Invasion largely draws from the same playbook: i...

item.title: The ‘Mad Men’ are dead! Long live the new advertising lions!
item.description: What looks like sector collapse is creative destruction: Advertising’s indie shops are going to win more business against the last lumbering giants, thanks to their laser focus on speed, strategy, and creativity. It’s been an unprecedented and brutal week for the advertising industry. The finalization of Omnicom Group’s $13 billion acquisition of Interpublic Group (IPG) (the biggest takeover in advertising history) is affecting tens of thousands of workers—most immediately the 4,000 expected to be laid off by the end of the year....

item.title: Canyon Deflectr RLS Bike Helmet Review: Game-Changing Safety Technology
item.description: Canyon’s latest off-road helmet is the first bike helmet in the United States to feature RLS’s game-changing safety tech.

item.title: Security News This Week: Oh Crap, Kohler’s Toilet Cameras Aren’t Really End-to-End Encrypted
item.description: Plus: The Trump administration declines to issue sanctions over Salt Typhoon’s hacking spree, officials warn of a disturbingly stealthy Chinese malware specimen, and more.

item.title: Forget cameras, AI, and chip upgrades – you really want better phone battery life
item.description: I asked TechRadar readers, "What's the most important phone feature?" The verdict came heavily down on battery life.
